==Japanese==
{{ja-kanjitab|うえ|き|yomi=k}}

===Etymology===
Compound of {{compound|lang=ja|sort=うえき|植え|tr1=ue|t1=planting|pos1=the {{m|ja|連用形|tr=ren'yōkei||continuative or stem form}} of verb {{ja-l|植える}} ''ueru'' “to plant (a seed, a plant)”|木|tr2=ki|t2=tree or shrub}}.<ref name="KDJ">{{R:Kokugo Dai Jiten}}</ref><ref name="DJR">{{R:Daijirin}}</ref>

===Pronunciation===
{{ja-pron|yomi=k|うえき|acc=0|acc_ref=DJR}}

===Noun===
{{ja-noun|うえき|hhira=うゑき}}

# a [[planted]] [[tree]] or [[shrub]], as in a [[garden]] or [[pot]]
# by extension, a [[bonsai]]
# a [[live]] [[tree]] in general, not necessarily in a garden or pot

====Derived terms====
{{der-top}}
* {{ja-r|植木市|うえき いち}}: a [[plant]] [[market]] or [[fair]]
* {{ja-r|植木算|うえきざん}}: “potted-plant calculation”: a kind of [[algebra]] problem concerning a set of evenly spaced [[potted]] [[plant]]s, [[telephone pole]]s, or similar objects, wherein the problem gives any two of the interval between items, total number of items, or total distance, and the solver is asked to calculate the missing data
* {{ja-r|植木師|うえきし}}: a [[professional]] [[gardener]] or [[landscaper]]
* {{ja-r|植木店|うえきだな}}: a [[plant]] [[store]], a [[plant]] [[nursery]]; [[w:Edo period|Edo-period]] slang for a neighborhood in the [[w:Nihonbashi, Tokyo|Nihonbashi area of Tokyo]], so called for the concentration of plant nurseries
* {{ja-r|植木鋏|うえきばさみ}}: [[garden shears]], [[pruning shears]]
* {{ja-r|植木鉢|うえきばち}}: a [[flowerpot]], a [[pot]] for [[planting]]
* {{ja-r|植木屋|うえきや}}: a [[store]] selling [[potted]] [[plant]]s; a [[professional]] [[gardener]] or [[landscaper]]
{{der-bottom}}

====Synonyms====
* {{sense|planted tree}} {{ja-r|庭木|にわき}}: a [[tree]] growing in a [[garden]] or [[yard]]
* {{sense|live tree}} {{ja-l|立ち木}}, {{ja-r|立木|たちき}}: literally, a “standing tree”
* {{sense|bonsai}} {{ja-r|盆栽|ぼんさい}}
